title: Dune 4K Movie Box Set Drops To Best Price Yet At Amazon For Cyber Monday
description: Dune 2-Film Collection (4K UHD) $30 (was $55) See deal at Amazon Dune fans can save big on a 4K collection featuring both of Denis Villeneuve's recent films for Cyber Monday. Over at Amazon, Dune 2-Film Collection is up for grabs for only $30 (was $55). Released in May, this collection includes 4K Blu-ray and digital versions of Dune and Dune: Part Two. You can also get the 4K Special Edition of David Lynch's 1984 Dune adaptation for $28 (was $50).Amazon also has several notable Cyber Monday deals on Dune books. If you're picking up the 4K Blu-ray collection, you should also check out The Art and Soul of Dune: Part One and Two, as both official art books are on sale for 50% off. You can also save 50% on Dune: Exposures, a unique book featuring writing by actor Josh Brolin and production photography by cinematographer Greig Fraser. And if you haven't read the original book series by Frank Herbert, Amazon has the Dune Saga 6-Book Box Set for only $40.59 (was $108).Cyber Monday Dune Movie & Book Deals:Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Disney Lorcana Gateway Board Game Is Only $8 In Amazon's Cyber Monday Sale
description: Disney Lorcana: Gateway $8.33 (was $25) with coupon Get deal at Amazon The recently released Disney Lorcana: Gateway Board Game is ridiculously cheap for Cyber Monday. Normally $25, this two-player board game is available for only $8.33 at Amazon. Make sure to click the coupon box on Amazon's store page to get the full discount, otherwise you'll pay $12.49.Gateway introduces new players. to the Disney Lorcana TCG, which has become one of the most popular trading card games on the market over the past year. A combination of gorgeous artwork, iconic characters, and a ruleset that's (relatively) easy to learn makes Lorcana fun for both card collectors and players. Gateway is an especially useful tool for teaching younger Disney fans how to play.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: What's on your bookshelf?: Games journalist and Slann butt-sculptor extraordinaire Kiera Mills
description: Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! As both Ollie and this immaculately-crafted Green Stuff Slann butt have already foretold, Kiera Mills is leaving RPS for pastures more dog-like. As such, she’s joining me to talk about books! Cheers Kiera! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf? Read more
author: Nic Reuben

title: The RPS Advent Calendar 2024, December 1st
description: This year’s RPS Advent Calendar has arrived, and it’s time for us to fill the nook behind each door with 24 delightful game-shaped chocolates. But man, it’s hard work making these chocolates. Too much manual labour. I wish we could automate the process somehow - perhaps we just need to exploit the planet’s resources and turn it into a giant chocolate-making factory spanning the entire solar system. Yes, that should work. Read more

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 858
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Stuffing or mashed potatoes? Both speak volumes to my carb-loving heart, but I love mashed potatoes just a little bit more. 2. Apple pie or apple cider? Um, both? 3. Do you have any Thanksgiving day traditions? Not really, although I do short circuit if I don’t get at least one slice of pecan pie. I gotta have it! 4. Have you ever hosted Thanksgiving? Yes, a handful of times, and yes, there was pecan pie. HAHAHA! 5. Something you’re thankful for? So thankful to spend time with my little family of El Hub, Connor, Rosie and Marnie. Our house is full and so is my heart! Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen P.S. Here are the questions to copy/paste with your answers in a comment. Talk[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 858 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 839
description: As most people know, Tabs was a demanding employer. He was also very fair to his employees. More than generous, actually. In keeping with his holiday traditions, Rosie allowed us to take the next two weeks off (thank you so much, Rosie!). Consequently, the employees of Tabs the Cat Industries, LLC have been up to their vacation shenanigans, which for me meant blogging while dressed up as a cat lady lumberjack. Makeup, of course, has been on Connor’s agenda, but she’s still perfecting her technique… Marnie has been cruisin’ the streets of Novato looking for tiny dogs with short legs to bark at — that is, when Connor isn’t demanding that they play dress-up together. We’ve all been enjoying this joyful break before Thanksgiving. I hope things are going well with you, too. We’re here and we’re feisty (just tired). 😊 Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 839 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen
